sense.name: organization
sense.commentary: An organization, either public or private, that exists to serve other people or organizations.
sense.examples: John has started working for the Central Intelligence Agency. The bestselling novelist was represented by a top-notch literary agency. The insurance agencies aren't supportive of my smoking habit.

sense.name: having power to influence
sense.commentary: AGENCY[+event] The quality of being able to act or influence events.
sense.examples: The baseball player's period of free agency ended last summer. We sinful humans only survive through divine agency. John's agency to command others ended after his retirement.

sense.name: being a representative
sense.commentary: AGENCY[+event] The quality of working for, or representing, some entity. Stative form of 'agent', as someone who works for somebody else.
sense.examples: I'm working under the agency of Mr. Smith.

sense.name: method
sense.commentary: How a result is obtained or an end is achieved.
sense.examples: Giving examples is the best agency of instruction. A violent revolution is the only agency of change!
